title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: This ancient thoroughfare formerly bore the name of " The Wynd of the Blessed Vinrin Mary in-the-Field," as appears from the charters of property acquired by the town for the establishment of King James's College ;x and it still retains some relics of this, its ancient ecclesiastical character. About the middle of the wynd, on the east side, a curious and antique edifice retains many of its original features, notwithstanding its transmutation from a Collegium Sacerdotum, or prebendal building of the neighbouring collegiate church, to a brewer's granary and a spirit vault.
